channel.title: WSJ.com: World News
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: The U.S. Has a Deal for Ukraine’s Minerals. Accessing Them Won’t Be Easy.
item.description: The resources could be plentiful but will be difficult and expensive to extract—even without a war.
item.dc:creator: Ian Lovett

item.title: He’s Held in El Salvador’s Mega-Prison, Without Any Criminal Charges
item.description: Carlos Uzcategui’s legal journey to the U.S. put the Venezuelan on a collision course with an “unprecedented” deportation plan.
item.dc:creator: Emma Scott

item.title: Foreign Jihadists Helped Syria’s Rebels Take Power. Now They’re a Problem.
item.description: Up to 10,000 fighters lent muscle during the overthrow of the Assad regime. But their hard-line interpretations of Sunni Islam make them a liability for the new rulers.
item.dc:creator: Omar Abdel-Baqui

item.title: Beijing Doesn’t Want America to See Its Trade-War Pain
item.description: Plunging trade across the Pacific is leading to production halts and threatening job instability for millions of Chinese.
item.dc:creator: Raffaele Huang

item.title: Ukraine, U.S. Sign Economic Deal for Minerals
item.description: The two countries finally reached an agreement after several false starts.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: German Spy Indictment Punctures Attempted China-Europe Thaw
item.description: A suspect is alleged to have gathered more than 500 documents for Beijing while working as an aide to a right-wing politician.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: The Next Pope Inherits New Tension With Jewish Community Over Israel
item.description: Amid the tributes that flowed in after Pope Francis’ death, a note of reservation stood out: Many Jews in Israel and elsewhere had mixed feelings about the Argentine pontiff.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: China’s Export Orders Plunge, Hit by Trump’s Trade War
item.description: Steep U.S. tariffs are starting to squeeze the Chinese economy.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Rheinmetall, Lockheed Martin Team Up to Produce Missiles in Germany
item.description: Germany’s biggest defense company said that it expanded its existing cooperation with its U.S. peer.
item.dc:creator: Cristina Gallardo

item.title: France’s Economy Struggles to Grow as Tariffs Threaten Fresh Drag
item.description: French GDP recovered only weakly at the start of a year that promises further pressure from trade tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Kirby

item.title: An American in Vietnam Tries to Navigate Trump’s Trade War
item.description: One Wisconsin man’s quest to link American companies with factories in Vietnam is running into huge uncertainties created by the White House’s efforts to isolate China.
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Mark Carney Wins Canada Election, Capping Dramatic Turnaround for Liberals
item.description: The party fell short of a parliamentary majority, while Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre said he would stay head of his party.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: Trump Wants Free Passage Through Suez Canal in Exchange for Houthi Bombing Campaign
item.description: Add Egypt to the countries Trump is pressing for a foreign-policy payday.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: A Canadian Technocrat’s New Mission: A Radical Breakup With Trump’s U.S.
item.description: Mark Carney won Canada’s election as a counterpoint to Trump—and now success means unwinding decades of foreign policy.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: France Blames Russia for Years of Cyberattacks
item.description: France’s cybersecurity agency said a group of Russian hackers that Western security officials call APT28 was behind more than a dozen attacks in France since 2021.
item.dc:creator: Sam Schechner

item.title: In Vivid Video, Beijing Vows Not to ‘Kneel Down’ to Washington
item.description: The Chinese Foreign Ministry denounced what it characterized as bullying tactics designed to shore up American hegemony and urged other countries to isolate the U.S. as a “small, stranded boat.”
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Israel’s Domestic Spy Chief Resigns After Battle With Netanyahu
item.description: Ronen Bar is one of the most senior officials to depart following the Oct. 7, 2023 attack.

item.title: Germany, Greece Ask for EU OK to Ramp Up Defense Spending
item.description: Germany and Greece want to drastically ramp up their ability to invest in weaponry and defense equipment as the EU scrambles to wean itself off dependence on U.S. forces.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: The Main Attraction at Vietnam’s New War Museum: Anyone Who Looks American
item.description: Children mob U.S. visitors for selfies and handshakes outside, while displays inside condemn Yankee ‘imperialists’
item.dc:creator: Stu Woo

item.title: Canada Is Voting for Its Next Leader. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Liberal Mark Carney faces Conservative Pierre Poilievre in what has become a referendum on how Canada handles President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Spain, Portugal Hit by Sweeping Blackout
item.description: Flights, transport and cellphone networks suffered disruptions. Power was beginning to return to some areas at nightfall.
item.dc:creator: Joseph De Avila

item.title: Houthis Say U.S. Airstrike in Yemen Killed Nearly 70 People in Migrant Detention Center
item.description: The death toll mounts from weekslong U.S. air campaign to deter rebel group’s strikes on ships in Red Sea.
item.dc:creator: Sudarsan Raghavan

item.title: U.S. Jet Fighter Is Lost Overboard in Latest Mishap Involving Aircraft Carrier
item.description: The strike group led by the USS Harry S. Truman, operating against Houthis in Yemen, has suffered two other recent incidents.
item.dc:creator: Nancy A. Youssef

item.title: Moscow Digs In Over U.S. Peace Terms as Putin Declares Short Cease-Fire in May
item.description: It is the second time in less than two weeks that the Russian president has called a halt to fighting without committing to a long-term end to the war.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: China, Philippines Make Rival Claims in Disputed South China Sea
item.description: Both countries have planted flags on a collection of sand bars, extending the clash over the area between Beijing and Manila, a U.S. ally.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: The Russian Military Moves That Have Europe on Edge
item.description: Putin is expanding bases and preparing to move more troops to European border regions far from Ukraine. “We’re expecting some conflict with NATO.”
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Driver Hits Crowd at Vancouver Festival, Killing 11 People
item.description: Police arrested a 30-year-old man and said the incident at a Filipino community event wasn’t an act of terrorism.
item.dc:creator: Lyle Brennan

item.title: Quebec Voters Worry More About Uniting Against Trump Than Breaking With Canada
item.description: The U.S. president’s threats to sovereignty cause many to put aside provincial concerns ahead of Monday’s elections.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Ukraine’s Crimea Lies at the Heart of Russia’s Invasion—and Trump’s Peace Plan
item.description: The military takeover of the peninsula was the first of Russia’s land grabs.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Chinese Manufacturers Are Scouring the World for New Buyers
item.description: Chinese textile companies are flocking to countries such as Indonesia in search of new markets to replace the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: China’s Industrial Profit Rose in March
item.description: China’s industrial profit rose in March, in part thanks to Beijing’s stimulus push, reversing the decline seen in the first two months of the year.

item.title: The Chinese Satellite Firm Washington Accuses of Helping U.S. Foes
item.description: Chang Guang, a civilian company with ties to China’s military, has been accused of aiding Russia’s war in Ukraine and Houthi attacks on Red Sea shipping.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: Russian General Killed in Explosion as Witkoff Makes Push on Peace
item.description: Steve Witkoff arrived in Moscow for talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin as Moscow pressed ahead with its assault on Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Coles

item.title: China Aims to Step Up Policy Support Amid Trade Uncertainty
item.description: The Chinese government pledged to coordinate policy to support domestic economic aims amid external economic and trade struggles.

item.title: Russia’s Central Bank Holds Key Rate, Warns of Tariff Impact on Inflation
item.description: Russia left its key interest rate unchanged for a fourth straight meeting, despite a continuing rise in inflation driven by the diversion of men and material to prosecute the invasion of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Trump Signs Executive Order Calling for U.S. Deep-Sea Mining
item.description: The administration moves to sidestep U.N. body governing the ocean floor and the harvesting of minerals and metals in international waters.
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Khan

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: India Has a Golden Opportunity to Capture U.S. Business From China
item.description: The world’s most populous nation has long trailed not just China but also smaller countries with nimbler governments.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Betty Webb, Who Quit School to Keep Secrets for Britain During WWII, Dies at 101
item.description: She was part of a code-breaking operation, and spent the last decades of her life talking—and learning more—about her experiences
item.dc:creator: Chris Kornelis

item.title: U.K. Supreme Court Rules Trans Women Can’t Be Defined as Women
item.description: The decision could have far-reaching implications for the protections and freedoms given to transgender women in the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Gareth Vipers

item.title: Attacks on Darfur Relief Camps Threaten Bloody New Chapter in War
item.description: Fears are growing that a rebel militia is using violence to consolidate control in the famine-stricken region of Sudan.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: In the Other Gaza, Trump’s War on Waste Baffles Mozambique
item.description: The White House claimed U.S. aid workers shipped 3.3 billion condoms to Hamas. They didn’t.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: Al Qaeda Punctures Kenya’s Dreams for an Indian Ocean Trade Hub
item.description: Militants based next door in Somalia have stalled the $25 billion plan for an economic corridor across Kenya’s impoverished north.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: While War Rages, Congo’s Neighbors Smuggle Out Its Gold and Mineral Wealth
item.description: The vast country is struggling to prevent Rwanda and Uganda from seizing some of its most valuable assets.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: World’s Newest Country Teeters on Edge of Civil War
item.description: A standoff between the president and his deputy is threatening to tip South Sudan back into ethnic conflict.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Comedian Russell Brand Charged with Rape and Sexual Assault in U.K.
item.description: The allegations came from four women, London’s Metropolitan Police said.
item.dc:creator: Roshan Fernandez

item.title: U.K. Prices May Cool as Tariffs Rise, BOE’s Dhingra Says
item.description: Global prices fell in response to higher tariffs during Trump’s first term as sellers in China and other countries lowered their prices to find other buyers, the Monetary Policy Committee member said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Airlines Battle to Recover After London Heathrow’s Day in the Dark
item.description: Carriers are working to rebook stranded passengers while getting aircraft and flight crews back in position.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Katz

item.title: Modi Positions India as Ally in Trump’s Illegal-Immigration Fight
item.description: India’s leader has supported the deportation of Indian citizens as New Delhi looks to safeguard U.S. relations and protect H-1B visas.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: This Indian Festival Hosts More Pilgrims Than the Population of the U.S.
item.description: At least 400 million people are estimated to have attended the event, believed to be at least two millennia old and now drawing to a close.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Trump Calls India a Tariff King, a Title Modi Wants to Shed
item.description: With tariffs on imports averaging 14%, India is especially vulnerable to the reciprocal levies Trump says he will impose on some countries.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
